meanings.definition: A person or machine that separates grain from chaff by blowing air through it.
meanings.sent1: The winnowers at the farm helped separate the wheat from the chaff.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a winnower to separate the grain from the husks.
meanings.sent3: The winnowers had a party, blowing air to separate the popcorn from the unpopped kernels.
meanings.sent4: The winnowers of truth sifted through the lies to find the hidden facts.
meanings.sent5: The winnowers worked tirelessly, ensuring only the best grains made it through the process.

meanings.definition: A device used for separating the good from the bad or desirable from the undesirable.
meanings.sent1: The winnowers on the market helped customers choose the best fruits from the bunch.
meanings.sent2: She used a winnower to select the ripe tomatoes from the unripe ones.
meanings.sent3: The winnowers at the store had a tough job separating the fresh produce from the spoiled ones.
meanings.sent4: The winnowers of fashion carefully selected the trendiest outfits from the outdated ones.
meanings.sent5: The winnowers in the competition picked the most talented singers from the group.
